topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade (Beta): Specifying the VCPU Model for a VM

body.p: You can select a particular VCPU model for a VM in order to leverage advanced CPU features such as SSE4.2, AES,or AVX on the compute nodes.
Note: This feature applies only to servers in the VNF Region.

When a virtual machine is launched, a Nova scheduler filter restricts the target compute nodes to those with available cores of the requested model, or better. If no such compute node is available, the error No valid host was found is reported.
If no VCPU model is specified, the default QEMU virtual processor is used.

ul.li: Intel Core i7 9xx (Nehalem Class Core i7)

body.p: Note: The Haswell model does not currently support transactional synchronization extensions (TSX).
To add this extra spec to a flavor using the web administration interface, see Configuring Flavor Extra Specifications.
